snippet: New questions emerge after Thomas Eric Duncan’s family released medical records about the Dallas hospital that sent Mr. Duncan home after his first visit to its emergency room on Sept. 25.
abstract: Relatives of Thomas Eric Duncan, Liberian man who became first to die of Ebola in United States, are denouncing treatment he received at Texas Health Presbyterian Hospital in Dallas, claiming that he was cremated without their knowledge or permission and given substandard care because he was African.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and JULIE BOSMAN
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Dallas, and Julie Bosman from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: New questions emerge after Thomas Eric Duncan’s family released medical records about the Dallas hospital that sent Mr. Duncan home after his first visit to its emergency room on Sept. 25.

headline.main: Ebola Victim’s Family Blames Hospital and State
headline.print_headline: Ebola Victim’s Family Blames Hospital and State

keywords.value: Texas Department of State Health Services
keywords.name: organizations
